frameDefinitions: An object Theme moves in the direction of a Goal.
In this frame, an Entity or Behavior is suspicious or otherwise subject to question.
An Event with multiple Participants takes place.
An Entity is declared to exist, generally irrespective of its position or even the possibility of its position being specified.
An Entity exists at a particular Location, at a particular Time, as observed by an implicit observer.
A Theme has access to a Useful_location or is blocked from it by a Barrier. '' 'Making services accessible to those with special needs is expensive.'
frameExamples: Some students <t>arrived</t> at the school on Sunday.
We found some <t>suspicious</t> checks lying on his desk.
MATAC looks forward to your <t>participation</t> in helping promote telework in the Mid-Atlantic region.
Finally, Poland ceased to <t>exist</t> as a state for hundreds of years.
Liquid water was <t>present</t> on the surface of Mars billions of years ago.
Making services <t>accessible</t> to those with special needs is expensive.
listRoleDefinitions: <fen>Theme</fen> is the object that moves. It may be an entity that moves under its own power, but it need not be.
<fen>Goal</fen> is any expression that tells where the <fen>Theme</fen> ends up, or would end up, as a result of the motion.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when arriving occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the arriving event occurs.
The <fen>Behavior</fen> is the state of affairs or action of the social actor that is regarded as susipcious.
An individual that is suspected of wrongdoing because of the <fen>Behavior</fen>.
The <fen>Entity</fen> metonymically stands in for a <fen>Behavior</fen> that saliently involves the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The individuals or entities that have been participants in an <fen>Event</fen>.
<fen>Participant_1</fen> is the grammatically more prominent participant in an <fen>Event</fen> with multiple <fen>Participants</fen>.
A grammatically less prominent participant of an <fen>Event</fen> with multiple <fen>Participants</fen>.
An <fen>Event</fen> with multiple <fen>Participants</fen>, who may or may not be involved intentionally.
A group, location, or institution conventionally associated with an <fen>Event</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the multiple-participant <fen>Event</fen> occurs.
The location where the <fen>Event</fen> involving multiple <fen>Participants</fen> occurs.
Some entity, abstract or concrete, which is stated to exist.
A time at which the entity is in existence.
Where the <fen>Entity</fen> exists.
The <fen>Entity</fen> whose existence at the <fen>Location</fen> is confirmed.
The <fen>Location</fen> of the <fen>Entity</fen>. The <fen>Location</fen> is conceived as a ground for an event of inspection to determine the presense of the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Entity</fen> is present at the <fen>Location</fen>.
The <fen>Theme</fen> whose motion is blocked or free.
The place or thing that the <fen>Theme</fen> is headed towards, despite a potential or actual <fen>Barrier</fen>.
An entity, event, or state that (at least potentially) prevents the <fen>Theme</fen> from getting to the <fen>Useful_location</fen>.
listRoleExamples: Thereafter, <fex>everybody</fex> participated in the 17 May parade ending in the Nordic Club.
Last year, <fex>Bill</fex> participated in the Montana State University Earth Systems Science distance learning course in the Atmosphere Unit.

The Second Amended Complaint alleges that Andrew S. Pitt ('Pitt'), Conectisys Corporation ('Conectisys' or the 'Company'), and BM
Capital Corp. participated <fex>with Zaman and Smith Benton</fex> in a fraudulent and manipulative trading scheme.
Some who participated <fex>in D-Day</fex> are finally ready to talk about it
Several of the countries were unable to participate <fex>in the market</fex> .

A survey of students who participated <fex>last year</fex> showed that 61 percent would be the
first in their family to attend college.
The most exciting tours for Mr. Osako were when he participated <fex>in France, Belgium, Holland, Cuba and Japan</fex>.

Ross and Hentlan on the Wye
the beginning of the sixth century
